title: U.K., EU agree to 'great' new Brexit deal, PM Boris Johnson says | CBC News
text: Prime Minister Boris Johnson said Thursday that the United Kingdom and the European Union have agreed to a "great" new Brexit deal and urged lawmakers to approve it on the weekend. "We've got a great new deal that takes back control," Johnson said. We’ve got a great new deal that takes back control — now Parliament should get Brexit done on Saturday so we can move on to other priorities like the cost of living, the NHS, violent crime and our environment #GetBrexitDone #TakeBackControl —@BorisJohnson "Now parliament should get Brexit done on Saturday so we can move on to other priorities like the cost of living, the NHS, violent crime and our environment." European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker tweeted "We have one! It's a fair and balanced agreement for the EU and the U.K. and it is testament to our commitment to find solutions." Juncker said he would recommend the 27 EU nations to endorse the deal during their summit later Thursday. The U.K. is scheduled to leave the EU on Oct. 31.
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Thursday that Britain and United Kingdom and European Union had agreed a "great" new Brexit deal and urged lawmakers to approve it at the weekend.
